item.text: When the queen of Sheba heard about Solomon, she came to challenge him with difficult questions.

She <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st><n id="1" /> with a <st data-num="03966" class="">great</st> <st data-num="03515" class="">display</st> of <st data-num="02428" class="">pomp</st>,<n id="2" /> bringing with her <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">carrying</st> <st data-num="01314" class="">spices</st>,<n id="3" /> a <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07227" class="">large quantity</st> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, and <st data-num="03368" class="">precious</st> <st data-num="068" class="">gems</st>. She <st data-num="0935 0413">visited</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> and <st data-num="01696" class="">discussed</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">with</st> him <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">on</st> her <st data-num="03824" class="">mind</st>.

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">answered</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> her <st data-num="01697" class="">questions</st>; there <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">question</st> <st data-num="05956" class="">too complex</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="04428 0834 03808 05046 ">king</st>.<n id="1" />

When the <st data-num="04436" class="">queen</st> of <st data-num="07614" class="">Sheba</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> for herself <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon’s</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">extensive</st> <st data-num="02451" class="">wisdom</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01004 0834">palace</st><n id="2" /> he had <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st>,
the food in his banquet hall, his servants and attendants, their robes, his cupbearers, and his burnt offerings which he presented in the Lord’s temple, she was amazed.

She <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, “The <st data-num="01697 0834">report</st> I <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> in my own <st data-num="0776" class="">country</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">about</st> your <st data-num="01697" class="">wise sayings</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> <st data-num="02451" class="">insight</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="0571" class="">true</st>!

I did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0539" class="">believe</st> these <st data-num="01697" class="">things</st> <st data-num="05704 0834">until</st> I <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> them with my own <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st>. <st data-num="02009" class="">Indeed</st>, I <st data-num="03808" class="">didn’t</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">hear</st> even <st data-num="02677" class="">half</st> the story!<n id="1" /> Your <st data-num="02451" class="">wisdom</st> and <st data-num="02896" class="">wealth</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03254 0413">surpass</st> <st data-num="08052 0834">what</st> was <st data-num="08085" class="">reported</st> to me.

Your <st data-num="0376 05650 0428">attendants</st>, who <st data-num="05975" class="">stand</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> you <st data-num="08548" class="">at all times</st> and <st data-num="08085" class="">hear</st> your <st data-num="02451" class="">wise sayings</st>, are <st data-num="0835" class="">truly</st> <st data-num="0835" class="">happy</st>!<n id="1" />

May the Lord your God be praised because he favored you by placing you on the throne of Israel! Because of the Lord’s eternal love for Israel, he made you king so you could make just and right decisions.”

She <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03967 06242">120</st> <st data-num="03603" class="">talents</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, a <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07235" class="">large quantity</st> of <st data-num="01314" class="">spices</st>, and <st data-num="03368" class="">precious</st> <st data-num="068" class="">gems</st>. The <st data-num="07230" class="">quantity</st> of <st data-num="01314 01931 0834">spices</st> the <st data-num="04436" class="">queen</st> of <st data-num="07614" class="">Sheba</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> has <st data-num="03808 05750">never</st> been <st data-num="0935" class="">matched</st>.<n id="2" />

(<st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram’s</st> <st data-num="0590" class="">fleet</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">carried</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> from <st data-num="0211" class="">Ophir</st>, <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> from <st data-num="0211" class="">Ophir</st> a <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07235" class="">large quantity</st> of <st data-num="0484" class="">fine</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">timber</st> and <st data-num="03368" class="">precious</st> <st data-num="068" class="">gems</st>.
With the timber the king made supports for the Lord’s temple and for the royal palace and stringed instruments for the musicians. No one has seen so much of this fine timber to this very day.)
King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba everything she requested, besides what he had freely offered her. Then she left and returned to her homeland with her attendants.
Solomon received 666 talents of gold per year,

<st data-num="0905" class="">besides</st> what he collected from the <st data-num="0376 08446">merchants</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04536 07402">traders</st>, <st data-num="06152" class="">Arabian</st> <st data-num="03605 04428">kings</st>, and <st data-num="06346" class="">governors</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03967" class="">200</st> <st data-num="06793" class="">large shields</st> of <st data-num="07820" class="">hammered</st> <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>; <st data-num="08337 03967">600</st> measures<n id="1" /> of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> were <st data-num="05927" class="">used</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">each</st> <st data-num="06793" class="">shield</st>.
He also made 300 small shields of hammered gold; three minas of gold were used for each of these shields. The king placed them in the Palace of the Lebanon Forest.
The king made a large throne decorated with ivory and overlaid it with pure gold.

There were <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="04609" class="">steps</st> leading up to the <st data-num="03678" class="">throne</st>, and the <st data-num="0310" class="">back</st> of <st data-num="03678" class="">it</st> was <st data-num="05696" class="">rounded</st> on <st data-num="07218" class="">top</st>. The <st data-num="0413 04725 07675">throne</st> had <st data-num="02088 02088">two</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">armrests</st> with <st data-num="08147" class="">a statue of a</st> <st data-num="0738" class="">lion</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">standing</st> <st data-num="0681 03027">on each side</st>.<n id="1" />
There were 12 statues of lions on the six steps, one lion at each end of each step. There was nothing like it in any other kingdom.

All of King Solomon’s cups were made of gold, and all the household items in the Palace of the Lebanon Forest were made of pure gold. There were no silver items, for silver was not considered very valuable in Solomon’s time.
Along with Hiram’s fleet, the king had a fleet of large merchant ships that sailed the sea. Once every three years the fleet came into port with cargoes of gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
King Solomon was wealthier and wiser than any of the kings of the earth.

<st data-num="03605" class="">Everyone</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">world</st> <st data-num="01245" class="">wanted</st> to <st data-num="06440" class="">visit</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> to <st data-num="08085" class="">see</st> him <st data-num="08085" class="">display</st> his <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>-<st data-num="0834 05414 03820">given</st> <st data-num="02451" class="">wisdom</st>.<n id="2" />
Year after year visitors brought their gifts, which included items of silver, items of gold, clothes, perfume, spices, horses, and mules.
Solomon accumulated chariots and horses. He had 1,400 chariots and 12,000 horses. He kept them in assigned cities and in Jerusalem.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st> <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st> as plentiful<n id="1" /> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> as <st data-num="068" class="">stones</st>; <st data-num="0730" class="">cedar</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">was</st><n id="2" /> as <st data-num="07230" class="">plentiful</st> as <st data-num="08256 0834">sycamore fig trees</st> are in the <st data-num="08219" class="">foothills</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="04161" class="">acquired</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">his</st> <st data-num="05483" class="">horses</st> from <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st><n id="1" /> and from <st data-num="04723" class="">Que</st>; the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="05503" class="">traders</st> <st data-num="03947 04242">purchased</st> them from <st data-num="04723" class="">Que</st>.
They paid 600 silver pieces for each chariot from Egypt and 150 silver pieces for each horse. They also sold chariots and horses to all the kings of the Hittites and to the kings of Syria.
